page.title: 08HOUSING, FAIRLIGHT E. SUSSEX
page.content:
Fairlight, East Sussex expanded considerably during the l960's when land at Fairlight Cove was made available for retired people to buy. Individually designed detached bungalows built of brick with tiled roofs and gas-fired central heating were constructed. The bungalows are near Hastings Country Park and the village shop, and some face the sea. Three bedroomed properties cost about Â£60,000 and two bedroomed cost Â£50,000
l9th century houses, mostly detached, and some short terraces can be seen along Fairlight, Pett and Rye Roads, and 20th century houses and bungalows fill the gaps between the older properties forming the ribbon development of Pett and Fairlight. Farmhouses are scattered throughout the area.
